intro: Simaba blanchetii, commonly known as the West Indian mahogany, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth upper surface. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by dark, fleshy berries. Due to its valuable timber, it is also considered an endangered species in its native habitat.
